meanings.definition: A large, heavy book, typically one that is scholarly.
meanings.sent1: The ancient library held a massive tome filled with knowledge.
meanings.sent2: She carried a tome under her arm as she walked to the library.
meanings.sent3: The wizard used the tome as a makeshift weight to exercise his mind.
meanings.sent4: The tome of history lay open, revealing the secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The tome's pages whispered stories of old civilizations.

meanings.definition: A volume forming part of a larger work.
meanings.sent1: The first tome of the series introduced the main characters.
meanings.sent2: Each tome in the collection added a new layer to the story.
meanings.sent3: The missing tome caused confusion in the sequence of the books.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a tome, each chapter representing a different phase.
meanings.sent5: The final tome completed the epic saga with a satisfying conclusion.

meanings.definition: A book, especially a large, scholarly one.
meanings.sent1: The professor's office was filled with tomes on various subjects.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours in the library reading ancient tomes on philosophy.
meanings.sent3: The tome on dragons was so detailed, it felt like a real field guide.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a tome of knowledge, with each page representing a different topic.
meanings.sent5: The tome of poetry inspired her to write her own verses.
